snippet.textDisplay:
No. I can’t have this. U less you are using a REAL REUSABLE MASK WITH FILTERS, you are spreading germs every time you use that waste of time. Even if you wash it. No way are you gunna convince someone that “your clean” with a mask that’s been reused before. It’s just a stigma in our society and I’m not gunna trust ANYONE w/ a mask like that. I know filters are hard to come by right now. If you can’t get them, then don’t go out, it’s that simple. If you need to go out for work, then your boss should be buying you the supplies, NOT. YOU.

Stay smart, stay safe.

snippet.textDisplay: I am soooo grateful for you! I am higher risk and can’t find a face mask anywhere in stores nor online! I don’t own a sewing machine, nor even know how to use one if I did! 😁 Your simple instructions with everyday household items is incredibly helpful!  I saw a video from a doctor that also recommends a paper towel sheet be placed in the middle of the pillowcase- as it acts as an additional filtering/barrier system and absorbs moisture. Throw the paper towel out after use, and launder your pillow case after each use. Thanks again! Ordering hair ties online is much easier to find than face masks! Stay healthy and safe! ❤️
snippet.textOriginal: I am soooo grateful for you! I am higher risk and can’t find a face mask anywhere in stores nor online! I don’t own a sewing machine, nor even know how to use one if I did! 😁 Your simple instructions with everyday household items is incredibly helpful!  I saw a video from a doctor that also recommends a paper towel sheet be placed in the middle of the pillowcase- as it acts as an additional filtering/barrier system and absorbs moisture. Throw the paper towel out after use, and launder your pillow case after each use. Thanks again! Ordering hair ties online is much easier to find than face masks! Stay healthy and safe! ❤️

snippet.textDisplay: You always knock it out of the park Katherine!! I have to say that whenever I see a new video uploaded I get a beautiful warmth come over me. You are such an inspiration between your smile and your ability to help us get off our behinds and stop feeling sorry for ourselves and do a little bit at a time and be responsible for our own happiness. You give us the resources not only fort the dollar store projects but for the other different apps that make you feel better and help you with your depression. I know how hard it is to live with someone who has an autoimmune disorder because I watch my husband and children worry about me and my mental health. Keep doing what you're doing and I'll keep watching and telling anyone I know to subscribe. I've had 10 friends subscribe and we sit and do the projects when I feel up to it. I love you your family and your channel. Hugs and prayers to you all!!!❤💕😙😙😙

snippet.textDisplay: nice video！ There's another way to solve the mask shortage, Ultraviolet light (especially at a wavelength of 253.7nm) can damage bacteria's DNA, this method can be used to disinfect the mask and extend its service life if it is not used frequently and is not broken. Find UV sterilizer at maisiebox.com
snippet.textOriginal: nice video！ There's another way to solve the mask shortage, Ultraviolet light (especially at a wavelength of 253.7nm) can damage bacteria's DNA, this method can be used to disinfect the mask and extend its service life if it is not used frequently and is not broken. Find UV sterilizer at maisiebox.com

snippet.textDisplay:
Hi Kathryn! I truly appreciate all the videos you’ve been putting out! These are to say the least, horrible, tough times we are living in. But we will get through this together! We just have to lift each other up and stop tearing each other down! I’ve seen so many negative comments in your feed and I just don’t understand them!
Anyway there was a comment from a nurse, @Teresa Fields She was wondering if there was a way to do these masks with ties at the back of the head instead of the hairbands because bands cause sores behind the ears for healthcare workers. So I left this response on her comment:
Could there be a way to do the same thing that you did in your video Kathryn, except instead of using the hairbands perhaps somehow either using a glue gun or some kind of fabric glue, attaching ribbon or twine or some other type of string along the top where the nose goes and along the bottom under the chin so that they could be tied at the back of the head? That way healthcare workers such as @TheresaFields here, could benefit. I understand about the sores behind the ears. So could this be an option?
Thanks again for all you’re doing! Please stay well and healthy!
snippet.textOriginal:
Hi Kathryn! I truly appreciate all the videos you’ve been putting out! These are to say the least, horrible, tough times we are living in. But we will get through this together! We just have to lift each other up and stop tearing each other down! I’ve seen so many negative comments in your feed and I just don’t understand them!
Anyway there was a comment from a nurse, @Teresa Fields She was wondering if there was a way to do these masks with ties at the back of the head instead of the hairbands because bands cause sores behind the ears for healthcare workers. So I left this response on her comment:
Could there be a way to do the same thing that you did in your video Kathryn, except instead of using the hairbands perhaps somehow either using a glue gun or some kind of fabric glue, attaching ribbon or twine or some other type of string along the top where the nose goes and along the bottom under the chin so that they could be tied at the back of the head? That way healthcare workers such as @TheresaFields here, could benefit. I understand about the sores behind the ears. So could this be an option?
Thanks again for all you’re doing! Please stay well and healthy!

snippet.textDisplay: The pillowcase option can be significantly improved by purchasing vacuum cleaner HEPA filter bags at a local home improvement store. Cut a bag into rectangles suitable for insertion into the masks before folding. This will filter out almost everything airborne and can be discarded after use.
snippet.textOriginal: The pillowcase option can be significantly improved by purchasing vacuum cleaner HEPA filter bags at a local home improvement store. Cut a bag into rectangles suitable for insertion into the masks before folding. This will filter out almost everything airborne and can be discarded after use.

When the folded and unsecured pillow case unfolds and falls off in a public place leaving the wearer fully exposed- do you feel good about that?

snippet.textDisplay: Now if you want a mask that can actually shield you way better: All you need is a bra, latex glove, a stapler and 2 rubber bands, and duct tape: First, cut the bra in half you only need one bra cup and cut off the strap and any lace or excess material only leaving the bra cup with its edges in place,   Cut through the latex glove all the way up, now strech that latex material over the outer part of the bra with the excess fingers facing the bra and tuck them under rest of latex cover (do not cut off glove fingers) ,  then staple the latex to the edge of bra from the inside of bra trim making sure you staple the smooth side of staple, to be on the inner part of course (because thats the side that is pressing against your face duh), and then a rubber band (size that works for you to keep mask snug), you staple each rubberband twice, that means once to the top corner and that same rubber band stapled to the bottom corner of the bra trim. Repeat this with the other rubberband on the other side. Now just use any color duct tape (about 3 stripes of tape to cover across the mask to give it a smoother appearance, because the latex may be a little bunched up and appear air bubbly in the center if you dont duct tape it.  and Done..enjoy
snippet.textOriginal: Now if you want a mask that can actually shield you way better: All you need is a bra, latex glove, a stapler and 2 rubber bands, and duct tape: First, cut the bra in half you only need one bra cup and cut off the strap and any lace or excess material only leaving the bra cup with its edges in place,   Cut through the latex glove all the way up, now strech that latex material over the outer part of the bra with the excess fingers facing the bra and tuck them under rest of latex cover (do not cut off glove fingers) ,  then staple the latex to the edge of bra from the inside of bra trim making sure you staple the smooth side of staple, to be on the inner part of course (because thats the side that is pressing against your face duh), and then a rubber band (size that works for you to keep mask snug), you staple each rubberband twice, that means once to the top corner and that same rubber band stapled to the bottom corner of the bra trim. Repeat this with the other rubberband on the other side. Now just use any color duct tape (about 3 stripes of tape to cover across the mask to give it a smoother appearance, because the latex may be a little bunched up and appear air bubbly in the center if you dont duct tape it.  and Done..enjoy

snippet.textDisplay: KATHRYN, THANK YOU SO MUCH. I HAVE A SUPPLY OF MASKS THAT I PURCHASED IN 2018 FOR CRAFTING/PAINTING. I NEVER THOUGHT WHEN I BOUGHT THEM IN GREAT SUPPLY, THAT I'D NEED THEM AT THIS TIME. I AM A SENIOR, I DO NOT DARE GO OUT WITHOUT ONE. IN THE LAST FEW WEEKS, I HAVE ONLY BEEN OUT BRIEFLY 3 TIMES. IT IS NICE TO KNOW THAT IF I EVER RAN OUT OF THE MASKS THAT I CAN MAKE SOME FROM MY PILLOW CASES THAT I HAVE PLENTY OF, ALONG WITH MY STAPLER, PLENTY OF PAPER CLIPS AND TONS OF RUBBER BANDS AND HAIR BANDS THAT I PURCHASED FROM 'OUR' 😊 FAVORITE STORE SOME YEARS BACK. OWEN IS SO ADORABLE AND GROWING UP FAST...OH MY! WHERE DOES THE TIME GO? GOD BLESS YOU AND YOUR SWEET FAMILY. I AM PRAYING FOR HEALTH AND SAFETY FOR YOU ALL.

snippet.textDisplay: Just to share in case if this helps, I found my sleeping ‘eye’ mask/cover that I got for free from Airlines when I travelled in the past really helpful as a substitute to a face mask during this time when supply is limited. Just make sure to wash after every wash. Some Airlines used to provide the one that is wide enough to perfectly cover nose, mouth and even until the side of the face. I think the one that I got was from KLM. Stay safe everyone!

snippet.textDisplay:
Eye protection is also a must. For those who don't have glasses a clear pop bottle can used to create a pair of goggles.

1.Cut the 2 liter pop bottle down the center to create two curved halves. The curve of the bottle will curve naturally to your face.
2. Cut a nose slot out to fit over the nose.
3. Cut holes for rubber bands or hair stays to be used to wrap around the ears.

To keep from getting cut wrap tape around the edges and where the plastic shield fits over the nose.

Using the above homemade eye shield + mask will greatly reduce your chance of getting infected.

Another idea is to use the pants leg of a pair of cotton dress pants.

The Viral Snick Hood ( based on the Bene Gesseritt head garment from Dune)

1. Measure the leg to fit on head snugly.
2. Use the half curves from the pop bottles from the first idea to create a ring for your head.
3. Staple the plastic curves to the inside of the pants. Your hood should like you are wearing a log on your head.
3. Fashion a round out of cardboard making certain to add flaps to the cardboard that are then stapled to the plastic curves.
4. Cut a slot out for your eyes.
5. Wear the plastic shield mask from above inside of the hood
6. Wear a home made mask on the inside as well.

Protecting the eyes, nose and mouth is crucial but so is hair. The virus could get trapped in the hair and then infected a person when they run their hands through their hair and touch their face.

A Spray Sock + Pop Bottle Shielding and Home Made Mask will keep your from getting infected much better.

To make a homemade spray sock.

1. Find a small or large pillow case.
2. Cut a slot out in the pillow case to see through
3. Wear the home made plastic face shield on the inside
4. Wear the home made mask on the inside as well.

Making gloves is relatively easy as well.

1. Make a pattern of both hands where the pattern is slightly larger than your hand.
2. The glove should go back past the wrist at least four inches.
3. Use cloth glue to glue the two halves together.
4. Insert your hand while the glue is drying to create a comfortable fit mold.
5. Remove hand and let dry overnight.
6. Add velcro strips to the wrist to create tightening flaps.

snippet.textDisplay: Just so that everyone knows wearing a mask when you’re not sick could actually do more harm than good. Masks are good at preventing you from spreading the disease to others but they don’t actually prevent you from catching it. It’s like a surgeon wearing a surgical mask in surgery, the mask is to protect the patient he’s operating on should he sneeze or cough, not to protect himself himself. Best way to avoid getting sick is to stay at home, practice good hygiene and practice social distancing should you have to go out
snippet.textOriginal: Just so that everyone knows wearing a mask when you’re not sick could actually do more harm than good. Masks are good at preventing you from spreading the disease to others but they don’t actually prevent you from catching it. It’s like a surgeon wearing a surgical mask in surgery, the mask is to protect the patient he’s operating on should he sneeze or cough, not to protect himself himself. Best way to avoid getting sick is to stay at home, practice good hygiene and practice social distancing should you have to go out
